description: A picturesque historical district on the left bank of the Svislach River dating back to the 12th-13th centuries. Once Minsk's trade and administrative center, it was renovated in the 1980s to recreate the charm of 19th-century Minsk with colorful houses, tile roofs, and cobblestone streets, now functioning as an open-air museum.
highlights: 12th-13th century settlement origins as Trinity Hill
State Museum of Theatrical and Musical Culture
State Museum of History of Belarusian Literature
House of Nature in former synagogue building
Troitskaya pharmacy with unique pharmaceutical collection
Sculptures of famous artists like Yazep Drozdovich
tips: Perfect for experiencing traditional Belarusian cuisine - try draniki and machanka
Visit during festivals for street performers and live music
Cross pedestrian bridge to Island of Tears
Best explored on foot to appreciate details
Cafes and restaurants have outdoor seating in warm weather
vibe: Charming, romantic, culturally rich - an enchanting pocket of old-world atmosphere where history comes alive through architecture, art, and authentic local character
